column4: Hello when I am installing Ubuntu with a minimal install CD, it gets to "Installing base system" and stops at "retrieving glibz1" or along the lines. Why is this and how can I fix it?
have you checked the md5sum before burning ?
i used the Check CD for Defects option
that usually happens when the installer is unable to contact the mirrors to check for updates
what should I do?
are you using the alternate installer ?
yes I am
when I had the problem in the past, I have switchted to another console with CTRL-ALT-FN
in the alternate install?
then I have checked the apt upadte pid with "ps -ef", and killed, the install process just resumed
yes
and that workeD? I will try thank you
you have a console that you can use for interactive commands, not sure which Fn is it
what exactly should I type in? theres over 300 things in ps aux
ps -ef | grep apt
umm would it be called apt-setup?
probably
its not there, but log-ouput -t apt-setup is
there must be a process running that is printing that "check for mirrors message"
did you kill it, or just timed out ?
maybe the servers are loaded down and its just taking forever?
could be, or your network was not properly setup, on my case it was a LAN without connectivity to the mirrors...
